column5: Hey all, I discovered this morning that I have a broken bracket on my garage door and now it won't open or close properly...this is not good    Can I get this part at Home Depot or do I need to call a garage door place?  I'd like to get it fixed this weekend if I can.  Thanks for your help...      Maureen
http://www.garagedoorsupply.com/  Hope all is well, Maureen.
If you can't find it easily Maureen.... Don Jones .. Garaga doors in Wyevale is the best in our area. 322-0136
You can probably get that bracket at the Home Depot, take the broken one with you when you go. If they don't have it, any overhead door supplier/installer will have it.

Like Glen says.. but watch... on some doors each hinge can have a different distance from roller shaft to door face length... so as he suggests take the bad one with you to match up. They are done this way so the door seats against the seals at the last moment instead of dragging down the full length of the frame.

Thanks for the help guys, I knew I could count on you   Since I have no idea of what the gauge of the metal is, I think I'm best to take it to a store with me.  I will call Home Depot and ask if they carry the hinges and if not Wayne I will call the folks in Wyevale.  Thanks again  Maureen
"If you can't find it easily,"   You might try the link...  No probs.
